page.title: 04Gloucester Cattle Market.
page.content: Before the Cattle Market was built the land it was built on was part of the flood plain of the River Severn.It was situated to the east of the Eastern Channel of the River Severn on land known as Mean Ham.It was used as the City rubbish tip until the level of the land was raised sufficiently for the Market to be built.Started in 1955 it was completed in 1958. On a site of 30 acres the Market is a meeting place for farmers,buyers and general public.It has become the biggest Market in the Gloucester area and the biggest barren cow market in the country.The main animals dealt with at Gloucester Market are cattle(calves) sheep (lambs) pigs (piglets).The top prices for cows are for Friesian Â£760.00 Hereford Â£548.00 Charolais Â£490.00 Ayrshire Â£325.00 C.I.Â£270.00.
